pull_request.body:
<!--
Thanks for your contribution!

Please ensure that any applicable requirements below are satisfied before submitting this pull request. This will help ensure a quick and efficient review cycle.
-->

**Description**

This adds a script for uploading apk files to browserstack.

The script can be executed as follows (from the repository DIR):

```
$ APK_LOCATION=*** BROWSERSTACK_USERNAME=*** BROWSERSTACK_ACCESS_KEY=*** node ./scripts/browserstack-upload.js
```

pull_request.title: [FIX] qs version for audit resolution
pull_request.body:
**Development & PR Process**
1. Follow MetaMask [Mobile Coding Standards](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VJLwTRsUw_5EDq_o8d6sSbXUAYENLurkRitYO45eY5o/edit?usp=sharing)
2. Add `release-xx` label to identify the PR slated for a upcoming release (will be used in release discussion)
3. Add `needs-dev-review` label when work is completed
4. Add `needs-qa` label when dev review is completed
5. Add `QA Passed` label when QA has signed off

**Description**
_1. What is the reason for the change?_
yarn audit warning
_2. What is the improvement/solution?_
Patch for qs package used in application from 6.7.2 -> 6.7.3 and other resolutions to use 6.10.3

**Checklist**

* [ ] There is a related GitHub issue
* [ ] Tests are included if applicable
* [ ] Any added code is fully documented

pull_request.title: use npm for dependencies
pull_request.body:
previously we were using git for some deps... this was blocking #5147 

it's also a security concern in the cases where we weren't pinning to a SHA

I worked with @Gudahtt to fork all the deps and publish them under the `@metamask/` namespace.

This PR makes use of the newly published modules.

I'm opening this as a separate PR so #5147 isn't so heavy handed.

comment.body:
> **Issue**:
> 
> when i attempt to swap an ERC-20 token i get `TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 'destinationToken.toLowerCase')`
> 
> see [recording](http://recordit.co/6zF9dIaDg4)

perhaps we should consider: `destinationToken?.toLowerCase` upstream? /cc @dan437

issue.body:
It would be great to get a Slack notification when a release is pending review.

This might not be _implemented_ here, but at the very least this README should include instructions on how to set this up.

Use Yarn for publishing rather than npm (#10)

Yarn is now used for publishing rather than npm. This is required when
using Yarn-specific dependency protocols such as `workspace:`, which
Yarn will resolve before publishing.

The README has been updated to explain the assumptions of this action,
and the example has been updated to match these assumptions.

pull_request.title: use npm for dependencies
pull_request.body:
previously we were using git for some deps... this was blocking #5147 

it's also a security concern in the cases where we weren't pinning to a SHA

I worked with @Gudahtt to fork all the deps and publish them under the `@metamask/` namespace.

This PR makes use of the newly published modules.

I'm opening this as a separate PR so #5147 isn't so heavy handed.

commits.message:
Use Yarn for publishing rather than npm (#10)

Yarn is now used for publishing rather than npm. This is required when
using Yarn-specific dependency protocols such as `workspace:`, which
Yarn will resolve before publishing.

The README has been updated to explain the assumptions of this action,
and the example has been updated to match these assumptions.

Bring README up to date (#12)

* Organize the description a bit better
* Replace the full example with a link to the module template so that if
  we change how this action is used we don't have to update this README
* Add an API section

pull_request.title: [FIX] qs version for audit resolution
pull_request.body:
**Development & PR Process**
1. Follow MetaMask [Mobile Coding Standards](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VJLwTRsUw_5EDq_o8d6sSbXUAYENLurkRitYO45eY5o/edit?usp=sharing)
2. Add `release-xx` label to identify the PR slated for a upcoming release (will be used in release discussion)
3. Add `needs-dev-review` label when work is completed
4. Add `needs-qa` label when dev review is completed
5. Add `QA Passed` label when QA has signed off

**Description**
_1. What is the reason for the change?_
yarn audit warning
_2. What is the improvement/solution?_
Patch for qs package used in application from 6.7.2 -> 6.7.3 and other resolutions to use 6.10.3

**Checklist**

* [ ] There is a related GitHub issue
* [ ] Tests are included if applicable
* [ ] Any added code is fully documented

pull_request.title: use npm for dependencies
pull_request.body:
previously we were using git for some deps... this was blocking #5147 

it's also a security concern in the cases where we weren't pinning to a SHA

I worked with @Gudahtt to fork all the deps and publish them under the `@metamask/` namespace.

This PR makes use of the newly published modules.

I'm opening this as a separate PR so #5147 isn't so heavy handed.

I worked with @Gudahtt to fork all the deps and publish them under the `@metamask/` namespace.

This PR makes use of the newly published modules.

I'm opening this as a separate PR so #5147 isn't so heavy handed.

commits.message:
Use Yarn for publishing rather than npm (#10)

Yarn is now used for publishing rather than npm. This is required when
using Yarn-specific dependency protocols such as `workspace:`, which
Yarn will resolve before publishing.

The README has been updated to explain the assumptions of this action,
and the example has been updated to match these assumptions.

Bring README up to date (#12)

* Organize the description a bit better
* Replace the full example with a link to the module template so that if
  we change how this action is used we don't have to update this README
* Add an API section
